Articles.Content:
I personally really enjoy Kerbal Time Standard because it kind of gives more immersion to everything. I don't really like it when a Mun trip takes about 3 hours in game time.

What do you think about Kerbal Time?

Edited April 7, 2014 by Legendary Emu
cuz

You realize that a Kerbal hour is the same as a real-life hour, right? It's just their days and years that are different (6 hours to a day, 426 days to a year). So a three-hour Mun transfer really does just take three hours.
I realize that. But what do you think of the days and years? Do you think it adds immersion or just adds a lot of confusion? "My base that has been running for a day went to running for 4 days."
You have to be extra careful when time warping now.

Why would you add a Nuker to the time in kerbal space program? When you can just go to settings and change it back to earth time..? Just wondering.

Edited April 6, 2014 by malkuth
I like it. If the universe is set in Kerbin Time, then everything is set in Kerbin Time.

I'm sure the maker of TAS Life Support is just thrilled by the change. For some time there was discussion on whether life support should be stored in 6-hour or 24-hour lots for each "day" worth of supplies. Now the player can have it either way.
I'd love to use Kerbin time. Unfortunately alexmoon's launch window planner uses Earth time, and I need it to make my interplanetary missions.
*whispers* I am still completely confused by the time display

Leave me out of this please

I am unwilling to deal with this stuff in BTSM for reasons I've clearly stated over there, but that has absolutely nothing to do with vanilla, nor should it be a factor in a conversation about vanilla.

Edited April 6, 2014 by FlowerChild
